action.action-desc: Mr. Keller introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to treat all institutions of higher education equally for purposes of determining the Federal share under the Federal work-study programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Work-Study Improvement Act.

subsection.header: Authorization of appropriations; work-Based learning defined
subsection.text: Section 441 of part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–51) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking community service activities and inserting work-based learning; and
by striking subsections (b) and (c) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this part, $1,520,000 for fiscal year 2023 and each of the 5 succeeding fiscal years.

For purposes of this part, the term work-based learning means paid interactions with industry or community professionals in real workplace settings that foster in-depth, first-hand engagement with the tasks required of a given career field, that are aligned to a student’s field of study.
The Secretary may not award funds under this part based on whether an institution of higher education meets the definition of section 101 or 102(a)(1)(A).
Section 442(d)(1) of part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–52(d)(1)) is amended by striking community service and inserting work-based learning.
Section 443 of part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–53) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking community service and inserting work-based learning;
by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: provide that funds granted an institution of higher education, pursuant to this section, may be used only to make payments to students participating in work-study programs, except that an institution may use a portion of the sums granted to it to meet administrative expenses in accordance with section 489 of this Act, may use a portion of the sums granted to it to meet the cost of a job location and development program in accordance with section 446 of this part, and may transfer funds in accordance with the provisions of section 488 of this Act;

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (5) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: provide that the Federal share of the compensation of students employed in the work-study program in accordance with the agreement shall not exceed—

subparagraph.text: 75 percent for the first fiscal year after the date of the enactment of the Federal Work-Study Improvement Act;
65 percent for the second fiscal year after such date;
60 percent for the third fiscal year after such date;
55 percent for the fourth fiscal year after such date; and

paragraph.continuation-text: except that the Federal share may exceed 50 percent if the Secretary determines, pursuant to regulations promulgated by the Secretary establishing objective criteria for such determinations, that a Federal share in excess of such amounts is required in furtherance of the purpose of this part;

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (8)(B) and inserting the following:
by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (2) and (3), respectively;

subsection.text: Section 446 of part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087–56) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 10 percent or $75,000 and inserting 20 percent or $150,000; and
by striking community service jobs and inserting career and technical job placement; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by striking 80 and inserting 50.

subsection.text: Sections 447 and 448 of part C of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended (20 U.S.C. 1087–57, 1087–58), by striking community service each place it appears and inserting work-based learning.
Subpart 3 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070b et seq.) is repealed.
The repeal made by subsection (a) shall take effect on June 30, 2022.

Notwithstanding subsections (a) and (b), sums appropriated under section 413A for fiscal year 2022 shall be available for payments to institutions of higher education under such section (as in effect on June 29, 2022) through the end of fiscal year 2023.
